author: Grateful88
title: Endoscopy University Hospital Wishaw
body: Attended Day Surgery for an endoscopy. Excellent organisation before the appointment, From the pre screening call, booking the appointment and attending the COVID test, instructions were clear and staff were really helpful. On the day of my procedure, staff were welcoming and put me at my ease. The team in the examination were really professional, welcoming and caring. The same high quality service continued in my post procedure recovery. Thank you so much to  everyone in the team at University Hospital Wishaw. You're amazing!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: honey 1958
title: Ambulatory care unit and cardiology ward derby royal hospital
body: Referred by GP with palpitations due to atrial fibrillation. I spent 11 hours here before being admitted to a ward. Packed waiting room no windows for air circulation no social distancing no cleaning all 11 hours no hand sanitizer apart from small bottle on reception desk. Did not feel at all covid safe. Admitted to ward 11. 30pm various procedures during early part of night. No sleep. Then moved to another ward at 4am. 4 bed bay nurse doing admission procedure talked very loudly felt sorry for the other 3 patients trying to sleep. 7am change of shift nurses chatting and laughing loudly and all lights turned on.. No thought or respect for tired sick patients who might need peace and quiet. I was appalled by the treatment but felt so ill couldn't complain.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: giftfs88
title: Extreme pain from infected wound.
body:
I called my GP as my Fiance was in extreme pain from an infected wound on his hand. They said that they were too busy to see him and that due to Covid we have to call NHS24 to get permission to attend A&E. Over half an hour on hold, then finally through and told that his injury was not severe enough to be allowed to go to A&E.  
A few hours later and he was in A&E, needing IV antibiotics and surgery for the wound!!!  
If we had listened to the advice of Nhs24 he could have lost his hand

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: januaryjz84
title: Lack of support
body: We knew as a family our mum had some degree of confusion, and this was confirmed when we brought her to an appointment for dementia screening. Mum walked into her appointment in March 2020, there was a sign on the door clearing stating dementia screening of which she could ask why she was there - "did they think she was mad" is what she asked us. Mum was seated in front of a display of leaflets advising on how to cope with dementia, ”support available“ etc. and again Mum could read and see these, again adding to her distress and questioning why she was here. We were then separated from mum, she was taken into a room with a nurse and student. My sister and I were taken into another room with a social worker.Eventually we were reunited when we were advised our mum had dementia and told what she had scored on the assessment. We were left with this information and advised a consultant would be in touch with us. We heard nothing, had no contact with anyone about this diagnosis, no support, no guidance on what to expect as her condition progressed. Despite us contacting the dementia team and requesting a follow-up review as mum's condition was deteriorating quite rapidly, again we were advised a consultant would be in touch. Mum passed away December, 2020 cared for at home and supported by her loving family without the support, guidance or input from any dementia team.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: shortand87
title: Relaxation
body: Made me fill relaxed and ready for the rest of the day.

author: Mummytobe2021
title: Antenatal Care
body:
Three completely different experiences of triage in the same pregnancy.  
My first admission I was cared for on triage and Rubislaw. I was admitted with abdominal pain and was cared for rapidly and very kindly. They were relatively full that evening so I was in another bay with 2 women and their partners, I feel I may have scared them with my pain as I wasn't the quietest. I am unable to remember much of my stay due to the pain, but my husband keeps telling me how wonderful all the staff on triage and Rubislaw were.  
On my second visit, I called with reduced movements. On the phone I was greeted with a staff member who appeared very dismissive of my concerns. I was given the advice to stay at home for 1-2 hours to monitor baby's movements, which I understand is protocol but I explained I had already tried the methods to get baby to move, this was dismissed by the staff member and they said for me to call back in 2 hours if I still needed their help, then abruptly hung up. This experience made me very uncomfortable, especially when I had to call back later as I continued to have reduced movements. Thankfully someone else picked up the phone and was much more friendly, I believe this was after a shift change. This experience made me feel like my instincts were wrong and that when I was calling triage I was being accused of lying about my baby's movements when I was just concerned.  
My third experience was much better, I called with reduced movements. The midwife on the phone asked the questions about trying to lie on my left side etc. When I informed them I had tried these, I was immediately believed and asked to attend. We were seen to very quickly and had a CTG monitoring and my vital signs checked promptly. The midwife was so supportive, when he could see we were anxious he recognised this and talked to me and my husband until we felt less anxious. We couldn't fault the care or staff during this visit and we were very reassured about baby's movements following this visit.  
Despite having 2 good experiences in triage, the second experience has made me extremely fearful to call triage again incase I am treated the same way.

author: No2
title: Lack of clear sign posting
body:
Absolutely superb service from all hospital staff involved once I arrived at the front door of the actual COVID vaccine centre.
My only point of concern relates to the absence of clear sign posting to the actual COVID vaccine centre from the point of setting foot onto the Ulster hospital, Dundonald site.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: peppermp78
title: The process was super efficient
body:
After an initial glitch with my first booking, second time round all went well. On the day of the vaccination, Sunday, I have to say the process was super efficient, the staff could not have been nicer or more friendly. The nurse who gave me the jab was from Banbridge, like myself. She explained the whole process, put me at my ease and could not have been more reassuring.
Well done all, you're all stars.
Harmond Nesbitt

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aquilapn63
title: Adult Carer Plan
body: I have been acting in the role of carer for my husband since August and over the last 6 months I have been trying to engage with my local Council regarding Self Directed Support to enable a more flexible and customised package of care for my husband. I was advised that I was entitled to an Adult Carer Plan and that this would be shared with Social Services and assist in progressing my request. I spent a considerable amount of time working with the Lanarkshire Carer Service to draft this plan. It is now complete and quite astonishingly I have been unable to share it with the Council - no-one has been willing to talk to me about it in the Social Work department and my link person in Homecare says it not within their remit. Even my contact in Lanarkshire Carer Centre has been unable to pursue this on my behalf. I have spent the last 6 months being passed from pillar to post and am totally disillusioned and frustrated that I am having to battle constantly to even get to first base with Social Work and discuss something which is a statutory entitlement.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Fayre
title: Telephone answering service
body: Rang endoscopy department in a panic about a Covid test pre treatment. Answering service excellent, keeping me up to date frequently as to where I was in the queue. Got through, very efficient and full answer to my query, thereby stopping my anxiety. A silly question, treated with care, concern and empathy.

author: mcf2021
title: Covid Vaccination
body: Highly impressive operation-slick, courteous and effecient. Every staff member was polite, positive and helpful at Craigavon Vaccination Centre.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: BighairyChris
title: Great service in tough times
body:
I became quite ill on a walk and started to feel nauseous. I tried to fight it off overnight, with little effect. It was quite awful, as any illness is, but being a fairly fit man and never been in hospital , I thought the world was ending!  
I have to say the paramedics were excellent when they turned up and quickly guided me to the hospital, when Kelly took over.  
I was admitted into ambulatory care and Kelly was excellent in keeping me and other patients in the loop and looked after. She was excellent and put my mind at ease, showing compassion throughout.  
I was transferred to ward A1 where I was put under the supervision of Natalie.  
I think Natalie has 2 twins who work alongside her as she was everywhere doing everything, really showing me how to multitask!  
The care and attention shown from start to finish was brilliant and worthy of this mention as during these times we need to help each other in whatever way you can. Normally I would have bought chocolates, however Covid restraints can’t allow that anymore, hence the comment box.  
If anyone does have the unfortunate case of having to go into hospital, judging by my experience, you will be totally looked after.  
Thank you

readBy.name: Warrington and Halton Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: pilingsxq74
title: Positive feedback regarding Covid vaccination
body:
I attended the Allander Leisure Centre, Glasgow for my first Covid vaccination. Everything was a very positive experience.  
The welcoming staff at the door guided me to the hand sanitiser and down the stairs , where another friendly member guided me through to registration and then to the table where Susie the NHS staff member gave me my injection. She was very clear and informative, I did not feel the injection and felt very reassured, After sitting for 15 minutes I left through another exit and came home. The whole process took 20 minutes , there was no waiting, everything was organised and efficient. Well done to all the team organising the centre and all the staff performing their duties. BIG CLAP to you all. Thank you

author: Eve60
title: Vaccination Centre
body: Had my first Covid Vaccination here on Saturday. From start to finish it went like clockwork. Everyone I came in contact with were so helpful and professional. They are doing an amazing job under such pressure. Thank you to everyone involved.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: nemofish28
title: Unhappy with treatment my mum received
body:
My mother has had cancer 4 times in a short space of 5 years and during these 5 years she’s only been put through A&E 3 times due to sudden problems that are due to the cancer treatment, she has not been the type that has been in and out A&E.  
The third time she has been put through into A&E was December just past due to bleeding from the vaginal area now this is very abnormal for my mother to pass blood from this area due to her first ever cancer diagnosis being cervical cancer the treatment made it impossible for this to happen due to the brachytherapy and radiotherapy, this is now meaning my mother can’t have children and Has gone through the early menopause. My mothers cervix actually closed over and she needed an operation he middle of last year to pierce a small hole to relieve the build up of blood.  
So, months later she was awoken at 3am due to the feeling as though she had peed herself and in a lot of pain in her lower abdomen to find out that she had been bleeding, her pyjama bottoms were soaked in blood the floor and toilet seat was covered in blood and she counted around ten blood clots in the toilet that she had passed. As her daughter i phoned the cancer helpline we were given as up to 8 weeks after treatment thats the best place to phone for 24hr cancer advice. they phoned our local hospital The Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy and was told to immediately go over. When we arrived at A&E the triage nurse was waiting for us and took us right through and done my mothers obs etc then taken us through to a bed further into a&e to be seen by a doctor. The doctor was brilliant although they hadn’t checked my mothers notes and it wasn’t until we mentioned that she was actually a cancer patient is when the doctor said they would go and have a look at her notes.  
Fast forward an hour and we were taken up into the gynaecologist ward. The nurse that had first came in also done my mums obs again and told us that she was told by a&e that my mothers bloods had been taken which was false as they hadn’t taken any bloods nor did they mention anything about her needing bloods to us. Another doctor had came in a while later to examine my mums stomach by touching etc and said thry would need another doctor to do the vaginal examination. to which a male doctor also joined with when they done the vaginal examination. When they carried out the examination my mother bled even more and soaked through onto the tissue and bed and also on the floor. The female doctor told us and the other doctor that she could feel something inside of her and was unsure what this was, the male doctor then felt inside and said he felt nothing he proceeded to ask my mum if there was a chance of pregnancy or STD’s and also asked if anything had been done to her cervix as it was very small, this was clear enough to see he had not read her notes or he would have known why her cervix was this small and how there would be no chance of pregnancy. She was sent away home within 5 minutes after the examination they handed her a couple of wipes to clean her vaginal area and was told she was fine to go home even though she was still passing bloody very heavily. She had to remove her blood soaking pad from the bed herself as nobody had removed this and nobody had came back to see her if she was okay. when she was cleaning herself up in the bathroom there was blood on the floor that was dried up which was obviously not my mothers and we had informed the staff of this which to me that is very poor infection control as it was someone else’s blood. Her discharge note that she got given had claimed this was due to the small operation she had months before this or a period. Again, this is another clear statement as to them not reading her notes due to impossibility of her not being able to pass a period.  
Fast forward to now my mother is now passing heavily blood with clots again and has informed her cancer nurse to which they have now fast forwarded her scan due to them being unsure of whats going on and my mother had a conversation with her cancer nurse about this time in hospital and her cancer nurse had said herself that it is impossible for it to be a period due to again the impossibility of my mum passing a period.  
My mum now refuses to go to Victoria hospital due to the way she was treated and felt very violated. I didn’t actually want to write this but i don’t want anybody to experience what my mum has went through. I’m not saying all doctors are like this as i’ve seen some amazing doctors that’s helped my mum and even my family through the past 6 years but the way she’s been treated this time is horrific. As a 19 year old girl i shouldn’t have to be writing this but my mum but she should get the compassion and care she deserves. this is highlighted very well on the nhs website and should apply to everyone not just my mum.  
thank you for your time.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: mercurykr59
title: Very reassuring staff
body: The doctor and nurses doing the endoscopy were very reassuring and done their best to make the experience minimally distressing. They talked me through everything and the nurse really helped me get through it by just being there and holding my hand.

author: pyxisnc98
title: Staff attitude and coldness
body: I called to get information about my dad that passed of Covid. Took over 2 hours to get through to records. When the call was finally answered, the staff member instantly came across argumentative. Even though they knew I was calling about my dad that passed of Covid. Spoke to me in a rude voice and said that they can't give me details when dad was admitted, even to family. There was no need for the coldness and attitude. This person made me feel so upset and I was crying. They really did not have to be so cold-hearted.

readBy.name: University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Maraz
title: Covid vaccination
body: Recently visited hospital covid vaccine site. I would like to congratulate all who took part with the organisation of this massive undertaking. Thank you to all the team from the porters to the nursing staff who are working together as a very professional team. It was a very humbling experience and I personally feel very lucky to have had the chance to even get a vaccine. Thank you again.

author: vulpecularc49
title: Impressed with the whole setup
body:
I was just at the Ulster Hospital getting my vaccination. I'm just very impressed with the whole setup from start to finish. Everything was so pleasant and so well organised.  
I don't think that any of the people involved in this, from top to bottom, are being paid enough for this service.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mambo
title: Covid Vaccination
body: I attended the Tait Hall for my covid vaccination yesterday. Despite it being a miserable cold wet day I would like to commend all staff employed on the day, they were cheery, helpful and very professional and everything went according to plan.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: pb2021
title: Waiting for a Vaccination for my elderly Mother
body:
I am writing about my mother, who is in her late 90's.  
My mother is still waiting to be told when she will receive her first Covid vaccination.  
She is housebound and receives 4 carer visits each day. I have Power of Attorney and am also responsible for her care.  
Following the advice put out by the Scottish Government and NHS Scotland, I had held off contacting my Mum’s doctor, but having heard nothing I contacted her GP practice in late January. I was advised that I should speak to the District Nurses, who I called the following Monday morning. I was then advised that I should again speak to Mum’s GP practice. The GP surgery advised me that there had been a mix up and that my mother was on the "Housebound List" but still couldn’t tell me when she would receive her jab because the vaccine was being administered by a team that was not connected to the practice.  
The GP surgery advised me when I called again later in the week that she may not get her vaccination until the following week but still could not tell me when this would be, only that the vaccination team would contact my mother or me before visiting. When I called again on the Friday they again confirmed she was on the "Housebound List” and they thought the vaccination team may be working over the weekend. However, it is now the end of the weekend and we have still not heard anything.  
My Mum is becoming increasingly concerned that she has not yet been vaccinated and that the message being put out by the Scottish and UK governments and the news media is at odds with her own experience.  
Today I called the Public Health Scotland Coronavirus Helpline to see if they could help, or at least shed some light on my mother's situation. Unfortunately, despite much sympathy and patient listening to my Mum's story, after 4 phone calls, passing me from "option 2" to "option 1" and back again, I was none the wiser - in fact less so, since the Helpline could find no record of my Mum's CHI number so it would appear that she is not even on the system.  
The Coronavirus Helpline said they could do no more but gave me contact details advising me to make a complaint to the NHS and Greater Glasgow & Clyde Health Board. I said I wasn't trying to make a complaint and that I was just trying to make sure my Mum did not slip through the net, however, the helpline advisor suggested this would be the best way for me to go about it. I am now in the process of going through the various links and phone numbers although many seem to be Page not found or have messages along the lines of The feedback service is temporarily suspended as our teams are supporting management of the coronavirus (COVID-19) helpline.  
Meanwhile, the Scottish Government has said its Covid vaccination programme is exceeding expectations and that at 93% coverage it had met it's target to vaccinate the over 80s by the 5 February.  
The other 7% percent includes people like my mother and not just those who are unable or unwilling to receive the jag. They say that the programme is delivering ahead of expectations but I am worried that the focus is now on larger, younger groups and that some of the most vulnerable people, like my mother, are now being left behind.  
I am contacting here to do all that I can to bring my mother's case to the attention of those in charge of the delivery of the vaccine so that my mother and those in a similar situation are not forgotten by those charged with their care.

title: Fantastic friendly staff
body: I recently had day surgery and was so impressed and grateful for the way I was treated by all the staff . They took all the necessary Covid precautions and were really helpful and cheerful putting me at ease prior to my surgery. I love this hospital. It’s spotless and very calming

title: Covid Injections
body: Just to thank all the Practice Staff for the speedy, pleasant and extremely efficient administration of the vaccinations.

author: Morph246
title: Torrington Day Treatment unit
body: I find with the staff that nothing is too much trouble, we always have a laugh and a joke and I look forward to coming in for my treatment!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sailor147**
title: Staff at Torrington Day Treatment Unit
body: The team are friendly, helpful, understanding, thoughtful, caring and made me feel safe and comfortable

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: lou357
title: We need Torrington Day Treatment Unit
body: We need the day unit, without Torrington I would have to go to Plymouth, which I did for 4 years (I live in Northam) and the care at Torrington is first class, can’t ask for more, Ace, we need Torrington treatment unit.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Prompt action getting COVID vaccine
body: In December I rang the surgery to enquire about the vaccine and was given an appointment for the next day. Also given a date for my  second one both of which I have now had.  I am a 82 year old lady and feel very lucky to have such prompt action thanks to my GP surgery doctors and staff

title: Caring doctors
body: The Doctors take the person into account when assessing treatment options rather than just taking the symptoms presented before them. For me this is beneficial as someone had taken the time to consider thoroughly what options there are and what's actually right for the patient.

title: Excellent service
body: The professionalism of the department was exemplary. Problems handled with skill and understanding, I would thoroughly recommend them.

title: Excellent Service COVID 19 Vaccination Clinic
body: I attended for my appointment for the COVID 19 vaccination 22.1.21. Very efficient organisation at the surgery with lots of friendly and helpful staff. The process was reassuring and fast. Many thanks to the Doctors and  staff today at my surgery. I urge everybody when called, to attend and have the vaccination.

title: Nice place, nice people.
body: Nice, modern premises, pleasant people. I was a little anxious before my appointment but need not have worried.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: I have just had a Gynae op at County and would like to thank everyone concerned for the treatment I received. From admittance to discharge nothing was too much trouble for all the wonderful staff involved. The operation itself was performed to the highest standard possible and the surgeon and his team were so skilful, efficient and professional they are amazing. The aftercare on Ward 8 from recovery to discharge was second to none, I couldn't have been treated and cared for any better. The whole team should be very proud of themselves for the superb service they provide, thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Efficient practice
body:
A telephone consultation with the Clinician who was extremely pleasant and reassuring.
He has referred me back to my general practitioner for further investigation but has assured me that he has not closed the case file.

title: First Class Vaccination Performance
body: It is  a week since I received the first of the Pfizer jabs from Emsworth Practice in the Baptist Church. It was really brilliantly organised, as was the flu vaccination in the autumn. The staff deserve the highest praise once more.

title: Fantastic experience
body: Bought my 86 yo mum today for covid vacc with some trepidation. What a great experience facilitated by a bright happy inspiring team. Everybody without exception contributed to a great experience. Despite the difficult times we are facing, teams like this more in front line than many, experience felt far from production line imagined, personal, positive and kind, everyone bright and cheerful, reassuring for all attending. Thank you. You are all amazing.

title: Exceptional Culture and Capability
body: Truly caring first line staff - caring enablers and not gatekeepers. Solutions led diagnosis and discussion with GP. Very individual care and treatment plans for my severely autistic son. A ray of light compared to other experiences when accessing GP services. Simply outstanding leaders of care and treatment delivery. It is simply wonderful to know that the team at Parcliffe are there for us. A tower of strength in a challenging world for my son. Much needed and much appreciated. You lead the way and should serve as an example of excellence in action to other GP practices.

title: Excellent GP practice
body: Hard working and very pleasant staff. The doctors are excellent and the practice has looked after our family very well for over 40 years.

author: hapsw64
title: Broken wrist
body: hello broke my wrist twice this winter and received excellent treatment at Stirling minor injuries clinic and ForthValley Hospital. the staff treated me so well. Thankyou.

title: Excellent practice
body: Everyone at the surgery from receptionists to doctors are friendly, caring and professional.  I have not had many reasons to visit until now so rather anxious but everyone put me at ease and made we feel rather relaxed about another visit if I have to go back.  Well done everyone during these strange times and please accept my thanks

title: great practice
body: had a great helpful time in the department ,the staff were great ,many thanks to all. we are all so grateful for all your hard work

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Great Nurse highly recommend
body: Visited today for a smear and I was extremely impressed by the nurse. She was very friendly, helpful and professional and made the procedure so easy.

title: Great practice
body: Went for the covid vaccine at short notice today. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. They clearly care about doing the best for their patients and their community. Thank you!

title: Hope for all
body: Feeling very fortunate to have received vaccine at saxmundham health.  Extremely well organised in these extraordinary times,  a true example of how to respond and adapt to give us all hope. Thanks to all staff and volunteers for their hard work to keep us all safe, it’s all too easy for people to criticise and only give negative feedback when we need positivity as demonstrated by all those at saxmundham health.

title: I actually get seen at this practice!
body: I have been trying to see my old GP for months but always been number 40 + on the phone and then the calls would be cut off. I registered at Spectrum Health yesterday, called this morning and was number one in the queue and seen a few hours later. Thank you Spectrum

title: Excellent experience
body: Great efficiency from entering the building with clear instructions and friendly staff. Had to have an X Ray, not a long wait, again friendly and efficient staff. Covid secure and excellent instructions. Was referred to another hospital and the member of staff who promised he would call me when he had heard from them. He did just as he promised and called with my appointment. Very impressed and great, caring staff. Thank you for your hard work.

title: Professional, Methodical Care
body: The Asthma team (nurses, doctors, reception staff, support workers) have been absolutely excellent with my care over the last 12 months - life changing.  The professional, methodical, structured, timely and caring manner has been a delight.  I have been to two other hospitals on the route to being fixed - both very good - but Wythenshawe have been on a different level.  In my view, they should be the blueprint / benchmark on how healthcare is administered.  Thank you very much.

title: Great practice
body: Attended for covid vaccination excellent guidance on parking from local volunteers and the procedure was very smooth without any problems

title: Wonderful, Kind Staff
body:
I visited Hascombe Ward with my very scared child and the staff with their amazing calm, kind and professional attitude reassured her and put her quickly at ease. 
I couldn't be more grateful for their swift and attentive care and making our visit as positive as a trip to hospital can be.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful COVID jab organisation
body:
I have just received my first coronavirus jab at Hayling Island health centre, arranged via Emsworth Surgery. The organisation was superb and the whole experience was positive. A friend who had her jab at the Baptist church says the same.
We are so grateful for the speed and organisation of the Emsworth surgery response.
Thank you all

title: Speedy Response
body:
Following a telephone consultation at 10am with the doctor regarding my concerns of having DVT, I was amazed to have an appointment with the hospital for a scan at 2pm the same day.
Truly amazing response (especially during the current Covid situation).
Great team effort from all concerned at the surgery.
Many thanks 
Regards
Julie Monks

author: Avocado22
title: Stoma surgery
body:
I had surgery late 2019, following my surgery I was put onto a private room on ward 21. A day after my surgery things went downhill and I could not eat or drink without throwing it back up. I could barely stand up as I was in severe pain and the times I tried to walk I ended up throwing up.  
I was moved onto the main ward on ward 21 after a few days and I was constantly ignored. My abdomen was hard and swollen and I was still unable to eat or drink. There was one night where I was in severe pain and it took over four hours for me to receive pain relief because the nurse I kept asking forgot to tell the nurse in charge. My last day on the ward ended up with me being left in the toilet after telling the nurse that I am unable to wash myself. I had been waiting for my mum to visit everyday for her to help me. After struggling to walk back to my bed I ended up throwing up again.  
I was then told I was being moved onto ward 11 and the Porter came to take me. It wasn’t until I was moved that the nurses on this ward realised that there was something really wrong with me and there was a huge difference in the way I was treated. I was comfortable and they really went the extra mile to help their patients. I hope the staff on ward 11 are doing well!

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
body: My appointment was at 09.27 this morning. When I arrived by car the queue was enormous and I couldn't believe that I would be seen at my allotted time, but I was.  It was wonderfully managed in the easiest possible way, both efficient and professional. The staff gave their time up to help protect people. Words cannot thank you enough for all your care and hard work....not just the doctors and nurses but also the people stewarding the queues.   Thank you doesn't cut it, but none the less THANK YOU.

title: Management
body: Well, Knowone want to be in a hospital but if you need help like I have to yearly then what lovely people you have there from entering the building to my fantastic treatment.  Simply wouldn't want to have to go to anywhere else.  Many thanks all .  Brilliant

title: Excellent Service
body: I’ve been with the practice for a number of years and have always been satisfied with my care. I attended, separately, for Flu Vax and Bloods recently and received the usual excellent standard of care from the receptionist, HCA and Doctor. Thank you again.

author: piscesfy65
title: My story is about me
body: So I have had a lot of problems with my implant (3rd implant 9th year ). I never had any issues with them until last year my periods have been all over the place, my moods have been really bad one minute am really happy then the next a feel a whole rush of anger through my body and a can’t control it, my attitude sometimes too and am only 24 it’s like a rollercoaster of emotions everyday don’t know weather am coming or going. I have spoke with a lot of nurses and they all say the same and haven’t actually tried to help me solve the problem, I got put on one kind of the pill and it just didn’t work out so I had a consultation with Susan who was amazing! She’s actually listening to me and trying to help with lots of things we can try and just to try and help me! Such a lovely woman! More people need to be like Susan ❤️

title: Covoid 19 Vaccine
body: I went today to have my vaccine.  When I got there the queue was all the way round the block.  The marshalls moved people along politely and efficiently.  At the front of the queue I was asked my name and ushered inside. Everyone was helpful and kind.  The Doctor explained about the vaccine, injected me and sent me on my way.  I was ushered through a one way sytem out the back.  All this took 20 minutes of well spent time,  Thank you to all

title: Excellent practice
body:
We both had the vaccine today and everything was perfect. Plenty of parking space went in for injections really very quick and efficient.
No waiting and had our injections before our appointment time.
Extremely happy with the experience cannot fault it at all.
Thank you very much look forward to having the second injection.

title: Very well organised
body:
The Centre has handled the Covid disruption extremely well with the planning of the flu vaccination last autumn and now the Covid vaccination programme with a well thought out route to move patients through the building with minimum delay.

During that time I have need consultation with a GP and the return telephone calls have been very helpfull.  The recent call instructed me to call 999 due to experiencing chest pains.  This  resulted in my speedy admission to RCHT and receiving the best possible care in AMU and CIU for an angiogram and angioplasty, then I was home in a week.  Thank you for your very professional help.

title: Friendly and efficient
body:
My husband and I are not patients but just came for our vaccinations for coronavirus.
Every one was so kind, helpful, friendly and efficient.
Thank you

title: Slick efficient service
body: Despite our anxiety over the administration of the coronavirus vaccine the efficiency of the process and the geniality of the staff, from the car park marshalling to the medical staff was a brilliant exercise in efficient practice. Congratulations!!

title: Covid Vaccine
body: I came today with my mom for her covid vaccine at IMP. The services was amazing ran with smoothly, staff where very good, excellent.

title: Caring
body: Phoned then sent photo. I was asked to visit the surgery to see a doctor. As a result of this consultation  it was arranged for me to visit QA for a scan

title: 60 years of care.
body: I have been with the practice since 1963 at all three of the premises. Saw.me through the birth of twins, some unusual illnesses suffered by my 3 children and personal problems of various kinds. They have never failed me or my family and have managed brilliantly with a large increase in patient numbers and now the virus.  Well done to them all and thank you.

title: Ex volunteer
body:
After volunteering for a number of years here. I've found the Orchard to be one of the best psychiatric units I've ever been too,they do their best to accommodate every patient & the staff do a fantastic job & are friendly, hard working & very supportive compared to other units around Lancashire. They offer a fantastic service with lots of activities for all patients and go above & beyond for patients. The cleaners do a fantastic job in keeping a high standard of hygiene with in the environment. The patient rooms are to a high standard. 

I've enjoyed all the years here and will miss it i wish all the staff & patients the very best 💚🙏👏

title: Disappointing and frustrating
body:
I’ve been with the surgery for many years and have always been happy with the service - until the last year or so. 
The reception staff are so rude and very unhelpful. I had a call back from the dr on wednesday as I was unwell in bed .. he said the reception team will call me back with a blood form. I received no call back. I called Thursday morning and they told me ‘oh we haven’t done anything with that yet’. The dr is in a meeting all morning but we will call you later’ . Again- heard nothing. So I called back at 6pm and they told me it’s been posted to you. I asked for an email copy and they said ‘ oh we are far too busy to email this to you as we are so busy answering the phones. Call back next week if you haven’t received it in the post..’ what an absolute joke!  Drs are good but the admin is awful. So unhelpful. They have no manners and are just so rude.. I understand there are pressures at the moment but being rude to people when they are ill and poorly is NOT helping anyone . If you don’t like your job - quit. There are plenty of people would love your job who would have the manners and empathy to be able to do it.

title: Great care whilst under so much pressure.
body: I recently was a day patient on the cardio catheter ward for a liver biopsy in the radiology department. All through, I had such caring, positive and helpful staff. I hear of the extreme pressure the hospital is under but I met calm professional staff putting their patients care first. Thank you.

title: most efficient
body: Went for Corona virus vaccine -  although there was a queue, it moved very quickly and I was seen on time.  Lots of volunteer Marshalls.  The whole experience inspired confidence.

title: Very helpful
body: Great care and consideration shown to elderly family member over the phone. Everything possible was done to help and his requests were dealt with quickly, even though a faulty phone line was causing problems. Staff continued to attempt to re contact him until they were happy his needs had been met. Exemplary service in very difficult times.

title: Efficient and caring
body: I went for the covid vaccine, it was very well organised and all the staff were friendly and happy to answer questions

title: Outstanding Service
body:
On Friday 15th January I had cause to call on the assistance of the Ambulance service and the service they provided was simply outstanding. They arrived within 15 minutes and were extremely considerate, professional and reassuring.

Once in the custody of the East Surrey A&E, the first-rate service continued.

I cannot fault my experience with either the Ambulance Service or the A&E department of East Surrey Hospital. They were all tremendous.

On completion, A&E arranged an appointment with the Pendelton TIA clinic later that week as it was suspected that I might have had a stroke.

I arrived bright and early at the clinic and all the staff, both medical and non-medical, were simply superb, as were the staff at Radiology and the MRI facility.

I could not let my experience pass without expressing my deep gratitude to all involve.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: A great team
body:
I had my first COVID vaccination today. All the staff were very cheerful and professional. Thank you to you all.
😊💕

title: Outstanding Service
body:
On Friday 15th January I had cause to call on the assistance of the Ambulance service and the service they provided was simply outstanding. They arrived within 15 minutes and were extremely considerate, professional and reassuring.

Once in the custody of the East Surrey A&E, the first-rate service continued.

I cannot fault my experience with either the Ambulance Service or the A&E department of East Surrey Hospital. They were all tremendous.

On completion, A&E arranged an appointment with the Pendelton TIA clinic later that week as it was suspected that I might have had a stroke.

I arrived bright and early at the clinic and all the staff, both medical and non-medical, were simply superb, as were the staff at Radiology and the MRI facility.

I could not let my experience pass without expressing my deep gratitude to all involve.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Fabulous Practice
body: I count myself very lucky to have been a patient of this practice for quite a number of years.  They have treated me with care and empathy for many years.  Considering the current climate, I considered my foot pain problem very minor and I did not want to burden the practice with more work but I was in daily pain.  Using a combination of their e-consult system and telephone consultations, my issue has been looked into thoroughly, professionally and amazingly quickly given the unprecedented pressure on our NHS.  Thank you.

title: Truly amazing!
body:
I volunteered for a short period of time today to coordinate the vaccine queue at Riverbank.

The staff have been vaccinating for the past 3 days solid but every one of them had so much energy and the biggest smile, you could see it in their eyes!

They kept  the queue constantly moving so no one was standing outside for too long and I for one cannot thank them enough for giving hope to this community.

Thank you! Thank you!

author: Patient2021!
title: Felt completely at ease
body: I was admitted from my gp to acute assessment ward fvrh after suffering acute shortness of breath and wheeze. As a health worker myself I know it’s always hard looking after a colleague. On arriving I was made to feel completely at ease and reassured I was in good hands. A huge thank you to staff nurse Gillian an absolute credit to her profession, kind, caring and put me at great ease along with Trish nursing assistant. Cannot thank you both enough for looking after me. I truly appreciate it.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: COVID-19 Vaccination
body: In my opinion all the staff, both volunteers and professional, were extremely efficient and very polite.

title: efficient vaccination
body: A very well organised flow of people to be vaccinated against Covid-19. Plenty of marshals and everyone well aware of their roles.

title: amazing care
body: came in for a routine pacemaker test. within a couple of hours i was whisked off to the day ward and then theatre. During this process and after the procedure , i had nothing but the greatest care and attention. wonderful caring staff. They made something that could of been quite traumatic a very easy and relaxed process. cant thank them enough.

title: Remember the Porters to a great job too!
body:
On the 19.12.20 my husband was taken into A & E owing to an irregular heartbeat. The ambulance was initially called because he had Covid really bad.  Throughout the afternoon and early evening I rang for updates 2-3 times.  The first time I got through to a nurse who said he had had various tests but they were awaiting the outcome of those.  Aware of how manic the department must be at that time I called back approx four hours later and a male voice answered the number I had been given.  Wondering if this was a doctor I asked and the person said ‘No, I’m only a Porter, but how can I help you’?  I said he was just as important as everyone else in the hospital and to not sell himself cheap and then explained I was trying to speak to a doctor about my husband.  He said he understood, asked me to wait a second and within a couple of minutes the doctor came on the ‘phone!
I was so impressed the Porter took it upon himself to find the doctor and explain to him I was very concerned about my husband.  The doctor continued to then tell me the outcome of the tests etc.
The purpose of leaving this review is I hope that Porter sees this review and remembers talking to me, and how grateful I am to him for his part in my husbands recovery.  Well Done.

title: Covid Injections
body: Well Done and a big Thank You to Lane End.  Went for my vaccine today.  What a professional way it was all handled and how caring everyone was.  You are all working so hard but you made the experience seamless.  Thank you again

author: The artist
title: Fantastic care
body: I had to get a minor op on my arm at Stirling community hospital in Dermatology dept. The staff, David, Ildako and Eve, were absolutely fantastic - a great team even though it was Eve’s first day! They immediately put me at ease and gave me all my instructions for going home. All very clearly explained. A lovely team. Thank you.

title: Covid 19 Vaccine
body: My wife and myself would like to say how appreciative we are of the excellent procedures and processes that were put in place to enable us to have our vaccines this morning. One cannot thank all of the doctors and volunteers enough in supporting this activity. We realise how lucky we are in Maldon to have such dedicated people. God bless you all.

title: Quality Practice for Covid 19 Injection
body:
Today I went for my first Covid-19 injection.
No queues, no waiting. Staff posted outside to help
you get to the correct destination. very well organised.
Very professionally run.
I saw the very proficient nurse after a few questions i was given
my injection and I did not feel a thing.
I was Very well looked after and cared for.
I am looking forward to my second injection.
Many thanks for all your time and professionalism.

title: Covid vaccination
body:
I went for the first vaccination.
The organisation was superb, and staff were all very pleasant. Many congratulations.

title: Coronavirus vaccine
body: A very safe and efficient experience. Very friendly people managing the queue outside, and inside we moved quickly too. Vaccine givers were lovely. Thank you everyone

title: Covid injection
body: I just wanted to say how impressed I was with the way the vaccination centre worked, everyone was so helpful and kind,there was no waiting around, it all worked like clockwork, thank you all very much.I also found the link I was sent by messenger worked really well. Thank you to everyone

title: Extremely efficient
body:
Attended on Saturday 23/1/21 for a COVID jab. Quite a long queue on arrival but many helpers in place to ensure a speedy arrival at the business end of things. The lady who administered the vaccine was friendly and helpful and I had to ask if it had been completed as there was zero pain or discomfort. When leaving I was guided to a rear entrance to ensure social distancing.
I would award this practice ten out of ten as the process was seamless was start to finish.

title: Efficient Friendly Service
body: I attended for my covid vaccination today, and must congratulate the whole team. The organisation was brilliant, the volunteers friendly and efficient. I was through in 10 mins, and left with a smile on my face. Well done everyone, you're doing a great job. Thank you.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Been with this practice since 1980.The place always spotlessly clean. The  Doctors and Nurses...treatment room included,receptionists are the best. This has been demonstrated again in the fantastic and efficient organisation of distribution of COVID vaccine. Congratulations and well-done everyone.

title: COVID-19 vaccination process ... a very good…
body:
Visit to the Lane End surgery for the first COVID-19 vaccination.
From the notification of eligibility for the COVID-19 vaccination, to booking the appointment, organisation at the medical practice and the vaccination itself the entire process worked very well and was very well organised. Volunteers and medical staff were very friendly and efficient.

I was very comfortable with the entire process. Well done !

title: Fantastic practice
body:
I have been going to this surgery for over 20 years. Throughout the service has remained fantastic, from the receptionists to the doctors, to the nurses. They have a very flexible surgery with easy access to the doctor. In the pandemic, I’ve been able to reach the surgery through the NHS website. They were extremely quick to respond and were ultimately able to give me the care I needed. 

Highly recommended

title: Amazing practice
body:
Just had covid 19 jab - phone call from Arden surgery - amazing organisation of times and great experience at Balsall Common Medical centre
Thank you all

title: Excellent
body: I contacted the trust to request information on dental treatment I had in 2011. I sent an email on the Thursday and received a response on the Monday to say this had been passed to the dental department who would be in touch. I then received a full copy of my notes through the post on the Saturday, so just over a week from first contacting to receiving the information I required. Very speedy, excellent service from the clerical team!

title: CARING STAFF
body: I was recently admitted with breathing problems due to COVID. I spent 5 days in Ward AMU and received great care even though staff are under severe pressure. They were all absolutely wonderful and I thank them all for helping me to recover quickly. You really are a great team of Angels and I cannot Thank You enough.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Brilliant organisation of covid vaccinations
body: Just want to say how impressed I was with the whole organisation and experience of the vaccination clinic today.  Thanks to all staff and volunteers who all did really well.

title: Brilliant, efficient, caring & professional
body: I had my Covid jab today, and can't praise the staff highly enough. Everything nice and clear, friendly staff, calm efficient atmosphere. I'm a total needle phobic so I was very nervous - but I was put totally at ease by the wonderful staff, and the whole process was so quick and painless. Amazing! Thank you for all your incredible work, I'm very grateful to all concerned. I don't think I'll ever be nervous again!

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Excellent COVID vaccination
body: We arrived on time. There was a short wait handled with humour and care by the volunteers. Interactions were delivered in a clear and friendly manner. The vaccination process was efficient and friendly. The volunteers and staff deserves special recognition for their work.

title: Inspire Centre Covid Vaccine
body:
Extremely friendly and professional.
And I even received a badge and hand gel.  😂 
Some NHS staff should note being pleasant makes everyone’s day go effortlessly.  
Thank you

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
I have recently moved to Poplar Grove Surgery and it was the best decision I have made. Everyone I have spoken to at the surgery have been amazing and all so helpful. Every time I ring and speak to the reception they could not be more helpful. Every doctor I have spoken to so far take their time to listen and really want to help. 
So glad I found this doctors surgery.

title: Fantastic
body:
I attended a and e on Friday night due to chest pains and I just want to say what an amazing job all the staff did. From the triage nurse to the nurses taking bloods, ECG’s and X-rays to the doctor who treated me.
I could tell they were all so busy and working as hard as they could do do their jobs efficiently they seemed short staffed and over worked but they were all so nice and kind which I appreciate as it is a scary time for anyone to be in a hospital especially alone due to covid rules. They made me feel more at ease. The staff honestly should be paid more.
